data.title: Fix AI stalling after losing its conyard and ref.
data.body:
Speculative fix for #10852.

I haven't tested it, but the code speaks for itself.

data.title: Notify the server after installing a map.
data.body: Fixes #8233.

data.title: Unhardcode Explosion "Image"
data.body:
Adds `ExplosionCollection` property to `CreateEffectWarhead`.

Additionally - although I didn't test it - going by the code I believe that before my fix, `Explodes`, `Parachutable`, `WithBuildingExplosion` would only pass lint tests but NOT work in-game with anything other than "explosion", because that image string was still hardcoded on the effect itself.

Should make life easier for 3rd-party mods.

data.title: Longbow creation limits circumvented
data.body: Longbow unit limits (appears to be 10 units per helipad, or perhaps 10 units max, I haven't checked which directly) can be circumvented by reloading a longbow on the helipad while you have a constructed longbow (over the limit, triggering the "unable to build more" message) waiting and ready to deploy. When the reloaded longbow leaves the helipad, it will split into two longbows (the one you reloaded and the one you just constructed. Must be a semaphore glitch. This allows an arbitrarily large number of airborne units to be produced with a little finesse.

data.title: D2k worm attack sound not playing
data.body:
You no longer hear the worm attacking.
Must be caused by some recent change.

data.title: Remove sdk flag from default makefile.
data.body:
Linux distros are slowly migrating to mono >= 4, and most of them don't seem to be including support for the 4.0 SDK (probably because, as far as I understand, this relies on shipping binaries that can no longer be compiled from source).  This then leads to issues like #10248 and #10726.

This removes the forced SDK from the default makefile, but keeps it for our travis builds (which use the Xamarin mono builds that _do_ have 4.0 support) to retain compatibility with .NET 4 on windows.

data.title: Make objectives panel visible to spectators/observers
data.body: It also allows switching the context of the panel by selecting a certain player's view in the player view spectator drop down.

data.title: Replay hotkeys for pause/play/change of speed
data.body:
Related to #8972. I also added hint to button tooltips via edditing {mod}/chrome/ingame-observer.yaml or in case of cnc ingame.yaml. You can see the result here: http://imgur.com/a/kk64J

I added the hotkeys to OpenRA.Game/Settings.cs and added this functionality to OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/ReplayControlBarLogic.cs. Hopefully that is the correct place for that.

Keys are mapped to:
Pause/Play: Spacebar
Slow speed: F5
Regular speed: F6
Fast speed: F7
Max speed: F8

data.title: Feature request : include balancing tools/views in the editor ?
data.body:
Could it be possible to include some sort of "balancing views/tools" in the editor ? Like
- The shortest paths and their length from spawns to other spawns, from spawns to ore mines, or derricks,
- The room available around spawns, ore mines,
- The total amount of cash available for every ore/gems field (#9477 already exists),
- The accessibility of some locations for the different factions (chrono only, transports only, ...)
- And probably many other things

Globally something like http://www.sc2mapster.com/assets/sc2-map-analyzer/images/?page=2.
It would be easier to create and balance maps.

data.title: Fix and overhaul Linux appdata
data.body:
Our appdata.xml contained bogus unicode characters that prevented recent versions of Gnome Software Center from parsing it.  While debugging this issue I discovered the appdata linter, which pointed out a bunch more issues.  This removes all the invalid data, adds proper screenshots, and expands the description text to make the page look a bit more attractive.  This also adds the metadata to our deb packages in preparation for Ubuntu 16.04, and changes the deb maintainer back to me.

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 22 20 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/13796045/652d44be-eafc-11e5-9ea2-5da7383a885e.png)

For some reason I couldn't get OpenRA to display in the software center in openSUSE.  They ship older versions of the software center and appdata tools, but the file passes the lint tests there.  I suspect this may be a side effect of some other problem that prevents the software center from detecting that it is installed.

data.title: Long range ordinance exposure
data.body:
After a short while of play testing, I feel that long range ordinance is a fantastic offensive and defensive measure, but I also feel that they are over powered. 

The ranges and damages are fine but the ability for a unit to fire from within the shroud while also remaining concealed is unfair on the player being fired upon. 

I propose that if the player has a powered radar installation, then the unit firing upon them should have a small area of the shroud revealed around them temporarily allowing the player that is fired upon to counter attack with their own artillery or aircraft.

data.title: Changed grid in map editor to darker red
data.body:
Related to #10753. Added parameter General.HeightDebugColors for each terrain type in \mods\ra\tilesets. I changed the color from #FF0000 to #880000 with the exception of Temperate terrain, where it's only down to #AA0000 as too dark color blends with the terrain and can't be seen.

Changes can be seen on screenshots under this link:
http://imgur.com/a/1NNeX

I appologize for any possible fuckups I may have caused as this is my first pull request ever... but I hope it's all okay. :)

data.title: [RA] Official Map Pool: Alter Forest Path (2 players) - balance, aesthetics
data.body:
[**Forest Path, current**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7295/), (2 players)

Changes:
Players spawns and initial ore patches moved to equalize access for both spawns.
Altered ridges to balance build and unit access towards middle.
Change layout of actors around secondary ore patches to equalize access for north/south.
Varied the fauna.

[**Forest Path, altered**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9138/), playtested. No issues encountered.

![forest path compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13780299/2586548c-eabf-11e5-8718-3baf1f6a3a61.png)

![forest path compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13780338/5353c052-eabf-11e5-8ded-3df1f2e945f9.png)

data.title: Memory Leak (dedicated server)
data.body:
Hello guys,

I've run latest release over night in dedicated server mode.
This morning I noticed that memory consumption is 10 times bigger than it was yesterday.
This is called a memory leak and it reveals a severe coding error / incomplete garbage collection / ...

Let me know how can I help you with testing / providing data.
![snap6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16616074/13773595/537e8a5a-ea9a-11e5-9d86-063f332b19d7.png)

Thanks

data.title: Fixed AppVeyor after_test depending on a Unix cp command
data.body: Apparently without it the `cp` command relies on a Unix `cp.exe` available from an arbitrary depdendency we were not aware of and it vanishing was the reason for yesterdays failed builds.  Source: http://help.appveyor.com/discussions/problems/4291-cp-fails-on-every-build

data.title: Add an IsPlayerPalette flag to NukePowerInfo
data.body: Somehow I was stupid enough to forget about that in #10723. Sorry for the inconvenience.

data.title: Fix the --png command trying to use OpenRA's virtual file system
data.body: Fixes #10921.

data.title: Unable to get PNG from SHP in bleed
data.body:
The same Utility commands which works in release, does not work in bleed anymore and crashes.
Example:

```
$ mono --debug /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --png /home/ihptru/Downloads/mech.shp /home/ihptru/Downloads/temperat.pal
```

```
Error: Utility application crashed. See utility.log for details

Unhandled Exception:
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: File not found: /home/ihptru/Downloads/mech.shp
File name: '/home/ihptru/Downloads/mech.shp'
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Open (System.String filename) [0x00031] in /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/FileSystem.cs:239 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteLoader.GetFrames (IReadOnlyFileSystem fileSystem, System.String filename, OpenRA.Graphics.ISpriteLoader[] loaders) [0x00003] in /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/SpriteLoader.cs:79 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.ConvertSpriteToPngCommand.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0015e] in /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Utility/Program.cs:84 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.IO.FileNotFoundException: File not found: /home/ihptru/Downloads/mech.shp
File name: '/home/ihptru/Downloads/mech.shp'
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Open (System.String filename) [0x00031] in /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/FileSystem.cs:239 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteLoader.GetFrames (IReadOnlyFileSystem fileSystem, System.String filename, OpenRA.Graphics.ISpriteLoader[] loaders) [0x00003] in /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/SpriteLoader.cs:79 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.ConvertSpriteToPngCommand.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0015e] in /home/ihptru/Downloads/OpenRA/OpenRA.Utility/Program.cs:84
```

File exists on given path.

data.title: Change nukes to be able to damage submerged submarines
data.body: Closes #10812.

data.title: Fix some actors not being available for the neutral player in the map editor
data.body:
This is basically a follow-up from #10804, since both issues have the same cause, which just wasn't realized until now. For some reason I didn't put `LoadWidgetAtGameStart` at the end of the list for the `EditorWorld` in that PR, which would have already fixed the issue a while ago.

Fixes #10780.

data.title: Added documentation and lint checks to PlaceBeacon
data.body: Split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10756.

data.title: Add a ClosestEdgeCell and a ClosestMatchingEdgeCell function to lua
data.body: Makes use of the new methods introduced in #10851.

data.title: Support map-defined bot types
data.body:
This removes the `Map` usage from `LobbyLogic`, reworks the lobby and server to use the map ruleset for bots, and introduces a new `DummyAI` that can be used to fill slots in scripted maps.  This doesn't yet expose the bot info to Lua – i'm hoping that @abcdefg30 can suggest the best way to do this.

Depends on #10901.  We're almost at the end of this marathon rewrite, I promise!

data.title: Reference SubCells directly from MapGrid.
data.body: The SubCell data was moved outside `Map` a while ago, but the references were kept.  This changes the higher level code to reference the `MapGrid` directly.

data.title: Add xmldoc to some ISpriteFrame members
data.body:
ref http://logs.openra.net/?year=2016&month=03&day=12#19:27:49

```
[19:27:49]  <Phrohdoh> I'm a bit confused on the terminology in shptsloader
[19:28:26]  <Phrohdoh> We have a Size and a FrameSize
[19:28:33]  <pchote> yes
[19:28:38]  <Phrohdoh> But it looks like FrameSize isn't really that
[19:28:50]  <Phrohdoh> it may be the entire shp's max width/height
[19:29:00]  <Phrohdoh> but https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/f3c8dd0397723b15beb0d4b5455d4ff05556a8e4/OpenRA.Mods.Common/SpriteLoaders/ShpTSLoader.cs#L36 is actually the frame's size
[19:29:19]  <pchote> terminology failure there
[19:29:30]  <pchote> frame as in the frame around it (like a picture frame) vs individual frame in an animation
```

data.title: Fix multi-line tooltip padding.
data.body: Fixes #9986.

data.title: Introduce ISoundFormat for parsing sound files.
data.body:
This takes #10676 and changes `MusicInfo` to use the new `LengthInSeconds` property.

The original SoundFormat implementations would load the entire file up-front, which is overkill when we are only interested in the length.  I've worked around that by splitting out proper format detection methods, and then lazily loading the raw bytes only when needed.  This can later be changed to use proper streaming.

data.title: Fix Smoke facings to not track spawner's facing
data.body: Closes #10894.
